SEARCH
Package me.bristermitten.mittenlib.watcher

Class FileWatcherService

java.lang.Object
me.bristermitten.mittenlib.watcher.FileWatcherService
@Singleton public class FileWatcherService extends Object
Handles file watching operations.

  • Method Summary

    Method

  • Method Details

    • addWatcher

      public Future<Unit> addWatcher(FileWatcher fileWatcher)
      Add a watcher to the service.
      Parameters:
      fileWatcher - The watcher to add.
      Returns:
      A future that will be completed once the service is ready to use - some delay may be required for the thread to startup. File changes that occur before this future is completed may not be handled.

    • removeWatcher

      public void removeWatcher(FileWatcher fileWatcher)
      Removes a watcher from the service. Note that the watcher will not be removed from the underlying watch service until the service is restarted - the file will still be watched, but the watcher will not be notified of changes. If is operation leaves no watchers, the service will be stopped.
      Parameters:
      fileWatcher - The watcher to remove.

    • startWatching

      public Future<Unit> startWatching()
      Start watching for file changes.
      Returns:
      A future that will be completed once the service is ready to use - some delay may be required for the thread to startup.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the service is already watching (see isWatching()

    • isWatching

      public boolean isWatching()
      Returns:
      whether the service is currently watching for file changes. Note that this may return true even if the service is not currently watching, if the service is in the process of starting up.
      See Also:
      • startWatching()

    • stopWatching

      public void stopWatching()
      Stop watching for file changes.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the service is not currently watching (see isWatching()
